attributes.action: Extend the voluntary right to buy to all housing association tenants
attributes.additional_details: This will allow many tenants to be able to afford a house which they may have spent a significant portion of their life in and created a number of sentimental memories. The government should offer this to all HA tenants and give them the chance to buy the home.
attributes.background: For those who have been residing in a housing association property for 10 years should be eligible to buy the property

departments.name: Ministry of Housing, Communities and Local Government

rejection.details:
There is already a Right to Acquire for housing association homes.

Tenants of housing association properties built or bought by a housing association after 1997, or transferred from a local council to a housing association after 1997, have the right to apply to buy their housing if they've had a public sector landlord for three years.

You can find out more about the Right to Acquire here: https://www.gov.uk/right-to-acquire-buying-housing-association-home

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to change this scheme, but it would need to be clear what changes you wanted the Government to make to how this scheme currently operates.
